#Text=Exclusive interview with New Zealand republican , Lewis Holden
#Text=Friday , May 25 , 2007
#Text=Wikinewsie Gabriel Pollard interviewed Lewis Holden , the chair of the Republican Movement and a noted blogger who writes about New Zealand 's constitution from a republican 's perspective .
#Text=[ He is not to be confused with New Zealand economist Lewis Holden . ]
#Text=In New Zealand , Queen Elizabeth II is the de jure head-of-state , holding the title Queen of New Zealand , despite having very little actual political influence .
#Text=Surveys sometimes conducted shows that one in three New Zealanders generally support a republic in New Zealand .

#Text=Holden , living in Auckland , New Zealand , says that it is a way for New Zealanders to show that New Zealand is truly an independent country , standing on and emphasising our own strong tradition of democracy and politics . "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=I believe a republic is important to mark New Zealand ’s place on the map .

_	_	_	_

#Text=The issue is n’t that the Queen is doing a bad job , it ’s that she ’s doing the wrong job – the position of Sovereign has become symbolically out of step with New Zealand ’s aspirations for itself .

#Text= Some think we ’re part of Australia , some think we ’re a colony of Britain and others just do n’t know we exist . "

column1: #Text=He also cites that there is confusion over our Governor-General ( currently being served by Anand Satynand ) .
#Text=He gives Greenland as an example of a country with a governor-general , but is under direct rule from Denmark .

#Text=He also says that people often think that as a result of New Zealand becoming a republic , the flag will have to change , but says that this is also not true , and needs to be clarified , " My own personal view is that change should only be by referendum(s) , perhaps with different designs put to the New Zealand public – as to when that happens , before or after we become a republic , I do n’t know . "
#Text=Fiji 's flag still retains the Union Jack , despite being a republic since 1987 , and Hawii retaining the Union Jack as well despite being a state of the U.S..
#Text=Despite being a strong supporter of a republic , he believes that neither monarchists , nor republicans are the better patriot , "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=monarchists say republicans are disloyal to the Queen , republicans say monarchists are disloyal to New Zealand .

_	_	_	_

#Text=He does believe that both have New Zealand 's future at heart , but have different views and conclusions about it .

#Text=He does say that he has often been labelled as a  traitor " , and admits once that he was threatened with sedition charges , but " It never would have flown . "

column1: #Text=Although he is not sure whether or not his blog has actually helped his cause , " I ’d like to think so , but I ca n’t really say for sure . "
#Text=But he does know that several other blogs such as Kiwiblog , NZ Monarchy and Queen and Country have now joined the debate over the possibility of New Zealand becoming a republic .
#Text=Creating the Holden Republic blog , Holden says , was a way for him to articulate the case of New Zealand becoming a republic .
#Text=In 2003 , Holden became involved with the Republican Movement , a member of Common Cause , and is now the chairman .
#Text=During his course of involvement with the organisation , he has helped with research and analysis .
#Text=When he was elected to be the chair of the organisation , he pondered about shutting down the blog , but his readers urged him keep going .
#Text=" Common Cause is a group through which Commonwealth republican groups can work together to share information and ideas . "

column1: #Text=Lewis Holden says he is , despite not being a big petrol head , a Holden fan ; of course .
